publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-448 Fergus Ewing: Highland Virtual Airline Company—That the Parliament supports the proposal by the Highland Council, Highlands and Islands Enterprise and Inverness Chamber of Commerce to establish a community owned "virtual" airline company in order to seek to secure landing slots at London Heathrow Airport; believes that it is vital for the economy of the Highlands and Islands that there should be a method of protecting slots for Inverness, as for other regional centres at prime hub airports and that there should be recognised a public service obligation on the London Heathrow route to guarantee a slot on the grounds of economic necessity and peripherality; and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make explicit their support for this initiative.
S1M-448 Highland Virtual Airline Company (lodged on 21 January 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-448 Highland Virtual Airline Company (lodged on 21 January 2000) Brian Adam*, Alex Neil*

S1M-448 Fergus Ewing: Highland Virtual Airline Company—That the Parliament supports the proposal by the Highland Council, Highlands and Islands Enterprise and Inverness Chamber of Commerce to establish a community owned "virtual" airline company in order to seek to secure landing slots at London Heathrow Airport; believes that it is vital for the economy of the Highlands and Islands that there should be a method of protecting slots for Inverness, as for other regional centres at prime hub airports and that there should be recognised a public service obligation on the London Heathrow route to guarantee a slot on the grounds of economic necessity and peripherality; and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make explicit their support for this initiative. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Alasdair Morgan, Brian Adam, Alex Neil
S1M-448 Highland Virtual Airline Company (lodged on 21 January 2000) Tricia Marwick*
S1M-448 Highland Virtual Airline Company (lodged on 21 January 2000) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-448 Highland Virtual Airline Company (lodged on 21 January 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-448 Fergus Ewing: Highland Virtual Airline Company—That the Parliament supports the proposal by the Highland Council, Highlands and Islands Enterprise and Inverness Chamber of Commerce to establish a community owned "virtual" airline company in order to seek to secure landing slots at London Heathrow Airport; believes that it is vital for the economy of the Highlands and Islands that there should be a method of protecting slots for Inverness, as for other regional centres at prime hub airports and that there should be recognised a public service obligation on the London Heathrow route to guarantee a slot on the grounds of economic necessity and peripherality; and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make explicit their support for this initiative. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Alasdair Morgan, Brian Adam, Alex Neil, Tricia Marwick, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Adam Ingram

Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Alasdair Morgan, Brian Adam, Alex Neil, Tricia Marwick, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-448 Highland Virtual Airline Company (lodged on 21 January 2000) Donald Gorrie*
